questions.text: During a complex surgical procedure, a surgeon needs to access deeper structures within the abdomen. The surgeon selects a specific instrument known for its efficacy in various applications. For which of the following tasks is this instrument most appropriately used?

options.label: C
options.text: Retracting superficial layers like skin and subcutaneous tissue

questions.text: A 52-year-old woman presents to the clinic complaining of a persistent lump in her right breast. She first noticed the lump eight months ago, and it has progressively increased in size. The lump is now approximately 6 cm x 7 cm. On examination, there is evident skin ulceration over the lump. Based on the clinical findings, which TNM staging best categorizes the tumor in this patient?

A 52-year-old man undergoes an abdominoperineal resection for rectal carcinoma. During the procedure, there is notable difficulty during the lateral pelvic dissection, and postoperative assessments suggest possible nerve damage. What complication is most likely to arise if there was an injury to the Nervi Erigentes during the dissection?

options.label: A
options.text: Parasympathetic - bladder dysfunction and retrograde ejaculation.

options.label: C
options.text: Sympathetic - retrograde ejaculation and bladder dysfunction.

questions.correct_answer: B. Parasympathetic - bladder dysfunction and impotence.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Parasympathetic - bladder dysfunction and impotence.

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents to your clinic with complaints of recurrent abdominal pain, diarrhea, and a recent history of kidney stones. His family history is significant for similar symptoms, and his father had surgery for a brain tumor. Given the patient's symptoms and family history, which of the following is least likely to be associated with his likely diagnosis of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 1?

A 50-year-old man with a known history of Type 2 diabetes presents to the emergency room complaining of fever and low blood pressure. He mentions a painful swelling that developed in the scrotal region two days prior, initially appearing as a small boil but progressively worsening. Physical examination reveals the extensive involvement of the scrotum, as depicted in the attached image. Based on the clinical presentation and the examination findings shown, which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It is a type of necrotizing fasciitis

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical treatment is required in most cases

options.label: D
options.text: Orchidectomy is done on the affected side

questions.correct_answer: D. Orchidectomy is done on the affected side

questions.text: A 50-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after experiencing a head injury while playing cricket. He initially lost consciousness but has since regained full awareness and is currently alert and oriented. A CT scan of the brain is performed, revealing the findings shown in the image. What is the most appropriate management step for this patient based on the CT findings?

A 35-year-old man presents to the clinic complaining of occasional flank pain and a noticeable mass on his right side. He has a known history of hypertension, which has been difficult to control despite medication. A recent ultrasound of the abdomen, displayed below, reveals multiple bilateral renal cysts. Considering the patient's age, symptoms, and ultrasound findings, which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: B. Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents for a follow-up consultation after undergoing a total thyroidectomy for a thyroid mass. A histopathological slide from her surgery is shown below. Her surgeon has discussed the next steps in management, including possible treatments and follow-up protocols. Based on the histopathological findings and clinical context provided, which of the following statements is most likely incorrect regarding the patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Radioiodine scan is done after surgery

options.label: B
options.text: It is the most common primary thyroid malignancy in areas of iodine sufficiency

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman presents to the clinic with significant swelling in her left leg, which has progressively worsened over the past year. She reports that the swelling began subtly and has gradually increased to its current size. She denies any pain, fever, or color change associated with the swelling but mentions occasional feelings of heaviness. She has no prior surgical history and has not travelled recently. Physical examination reveals non-pitting edema of the entire left leg, with skin that appears slightly thicker than normal and without any varicosities or color change. Considering the patient's history and physical examination, which of the following is the most likely etiology of the findings?
A surgeon is preparing to perform laparoscopic surgery and selects the device shown in the image. What is the device and its primary function?

options.label: A
options.text: Metal trocar: Open technique of pneumoperitoneum

options.label: C
options.text: Veress needle: Open technique of pneumoperitoneum

options.label: D
options.text: Veress needle: Closed technique of pneumoperitoneum

questions.correct_answer: D. Veress needle: Closed technique of pneumoperitoneum
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Veress needle: Closed technique of pneumoperitoneum

questions.text: A 30-year-old fair-skinned woman discomfort but is concerned about the appearance of her surgical presents to your clinic six months following an elective laparotomy. She reports minimal l scar, which she describes as slightly itchy and more elevated than her surrounding skin. Based on the appearance and symptoms described, what is the most likely diagnosis for this patient's scar condition?

A 45-year-old man presents to the emergency department complaining of sudden, severe abdominal pain that started a few hours after a significant alcohol binge. He appears in distress, with guarding and tenderness in the upper abdomen. Abdominal finding is shown. His medical history includes chronic alcohol use and smoking. Which diagnostic test is to be done next to confirm the suspected condition?

You are reviewing the medical records of a 58-year-old man with chronic liver disease during a hepatology clinic session. You note that his management plan includes an evaluation of his liver function using the Child-Pugh score to guide further therapeutic decisions. Which of these is incorrect about Child Pugh score?

options.label: A
options.text: Assesses severity of chronic liver disease

options.label: B
options.text: Includes serum albumin, bilirubin and creatinine levels

options.label: D
options.text: Each component is scored from 1 to 3 with maximum of 15 points.

questions.correct_answer: B. Includes serum albumin, bilirubin and creatinine levels

questions.text: A pediatrician evaluates a child with vomiting that started a few weeks after birth. The baby appears mildly dehydrated but is otherwise healthy. A lump in palpable in the upper abdomen. Which of the following conditions is the most likely to be the cause of vomiting in this neonate?

A 50-year-old woman presents to the emergency department complaining of acute abdominal pain, vomiting, and observed bilious vomiting. She reports a surgical history significant for an abdominal hysterectomy performed two years prior. Physical examination reveals high-pitched bowel sounds. Abdominal X-ray shows multiple air-fluid levels and pneumobilia. Considering the clinical presentation and imaging findings, what is the most likely diagnosis?

During a surgical rotation, a medical student observes a procedure where the surgeon uses clamps to retract the lesser omentum and expose the structures in the hepatoduodenal ligament as shown in the diagram. What is the most likely scenario that describes the technique being performed?

A 42-year-old man with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) is being evaluated for a potential surgical intervention after medical management with proton pump inhibitors (PPIs) failed to control his symptoms adequately. He reports no other gastrointestinal symptoms except for persistent heartburn and occasional regurgitation. All of these are indications of performing 24-hour pH study in patients of GERD except?

A 45-year-old male with a documented history of peptic ulcer disease is undergoing evaluation for surgical intervention due to recurrent ulcers resistant to medical therapy. The surgeon discusses various procedures to reduce acid secretion and prevent future complications. Which of the following surgical options is the most powerful procedure for treating the duodenal ulcer?

A 55-year-old man with a history of choledochal cysts presents to the clinic for a routine follow-up. The patient inquires about his risk factors for developing ca bladder due to his underlying condition. Which of these is not a risk factor for it?

A 45-year-old man reports to the clinic with complaints of painless rectal bleeding noted predominantly during defecation. Proctoscopy reveals the presence of swollen, bulging vascular structures as seen in the image. The swellings cannot be manually returned. What is the preferred treatment?

A 35-year-old male, with a history of chronic smoking, presents with complaints of cramping pain in his foot after walking approximately 500 meters. The pain subsides with rest but recurs with activity. Examination shows no swelling in the legs, and dorsalis pedis pulses are diminished in the affected leg. What is the likely pathology?

A 45-year-old male with a history of varicose veins for four years now presents with persistent eczema on his lower limb. Examination reveals significant skin changes over the affected area. He has a history of an ulcer over medial malleolus which resolved with treatment. According to the CEAP classification, which stage best describes his condition?

A young male arrives in the emergency department following blunt abdominal trauma. His vital signs reveal hypotension with a blood pressure of 90/60 mm Hg. Initial management with intravenous fluids and a positive FAST exam do not stabilize his condition. What is the most appropriate next step in management?
During a mass casualty incident, the triage officer uses color-coded tags to prioritize patient care. Which of the following colors in the triage system correctly indicates its care?

A 65-year-old female reports a gradual onset of difficulty swallowing that progressed from trouble with solids to liquids over the last several months. Accompanying these symptoms, she has noted a noticeable weight loss. Given these findings, which diagnostic test should be performed first to identify the possible cause of her symptoms?
Identify the mismatched component in GCS:

options.label: B
options.text: V4: Unable to recognize date and time

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement pathology in the image:

options.label: A
options.text: The pathology is commonly seen in dog

options.label: B
options.text: The commonly affected organs are liver followed by lung

options.label: C
options.text: Excision is reserved for cases where other measures fail

questions.correct_answer: A. The pathology is commonly seen in dog
questions.explanation: Ans. A) The pathology is commonly seen in dog

questions.text: During a routine physical examination of a 52-year-old male, an anterior neck swelling is observed. This sign can be observed when the patient raises her arms above her head. What is the most likely characteristic of this swelling?

options.label: A
options.text: The swelling causes compression of IVC

options.label: B
options.text: The swelling should always be excised

options.label: C
options.text: The swelling moves up with deglutition

options.label: D
options.text: The swelling often receives blood supply from mediastinal artery

questions.correct_answer: C. The swelling moves up with deglutition
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The swelling moves up with deglutition

questions.text: Which of these is incorrect about the swelling shown below?

options.label: B
options.text: It extends into the neck by breaching the digastric muscle

options.label: C
options.text: It arises from sublingual salivary gland

options.label: D
options.text: Excision of affected gland should be done

questions.correct_answer: B. It extends into the neck by breaching the digastric muscle
questions.explanation: Ans. B) It extends into the neck by breaching the digastric muscle

questions.text: What should be the next step in a patient who presented in the emergency with acute respiratory distress, dilated neck veins, low blood pressure, tracheal deviation and hyper-resonance on percussion?

options.label: A
options.text: Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.correct_answer: A. Wide bore needle insertion in 5th intercostal space

questions.text: A 45-year-old lady presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain. An abdominal ultrasound reveals the presence of multiple gallstones with no evidence of wall thickening. The bile duct (BD) diameter is measured as 12 mm (dilated), and serum bilirubin levels are mildly elevated at 0.8. The patient's alkaline phosphatase levels are significantly elevated at 680, and the gamma-glutamyl transferase (GGT) levels are raised by 5 times. An imaging is does, which shows few small biliary calculi. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?
According to European hernia society classification (EHS), hernia labelled as PL2 implies:

options.label: A
options.text: Primary direct with defect of 2 cm

options.label: B
options.text: Primary indirect with defect of 2 cm

options.label: C
options.text: Primary direct with defect of 2 finger breadth

options.label: D
options.text: Primary indirect with defect of 2 finger breadth

questions.correct_answer: D. Primary indirect with defect of 2 finger breadth
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Primary indirect with defect of 2 finger breadth

questions.text: Which of these is not a high risk factor associated with refeeding syndrome?

options.label: C
options.text: Unintentional weight loss >15% within the last 3–6 months

options.label: D
options.text: Little or no nutritional intake for more than 10 days

questions.text: In a seat belt injury, which of the following organs is most commonly affected?

A patient has undergone cholecystectomy few days back and now the patient has presented with upper Abdominal pain. MRCP was done which showed leak of bile from the cystic duct stump. Patient is hemodynamically stable. Which of the following is the Strassberg type of injury?

A 10-year-old boy presented to the surgery OPD. On examination, his left scrotal sac is empty and under-developed. On clinical examination, the left testis was found in the superficial inguinal pouch. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In Modified Radical Neck Dissection (MRND), which of the following structures is preserved?
The following procedure is performed for the management of:
Identify the true statement about the procedure:

options.label: B
options.text: It is a type of NOTES procedure

questions.text: A 45-year female with a history of alcohol and smoking experienced sudden onset abdominal pain with vomiting. Examination revealed generalized tenderness. X ray is as shown. What will be the next step?
Identify the mismatched hernia types and the location of the defect:

options.label: B
options.text: Direct inguinal hernia- Medial to inferior epigastric artery

questions.correct_answer: C. Indirect inguinal hernia- Hesselbach triangle
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Indirect inguinal hernia- Hesselbach triangle

questions.text: A 40-year-old male underwent surgery for rectal prolapse, and an image was obtained. Can you identify the procedure that was most likely performed on the patient from the given image?
28-year-old male presents with right sided acute scrotum. Examination reveals tenderness which improves on lifting the testis. Which of these is the likely diagnosis?

A middle-aged patient came with pain in RIF since 5 days and tenderness on deep palpation. He is currently afebrile and pulse is 90/minute. Blood investigation shows increased TLC. A diagnosis of appendicitis is suspected. What is a false statement about the condition?

options.label: B
options.text: USG abdomen is the investigation of choice in adults

options.label: C
options.text: Laparoscopic appendicectomy is done if medical management fails

options.label: D
options.text: Rebound tenderness is seen in right iliac fossa

questions.correct_answer: B. USG abdomen is the investigation of choice in adults
questions.explanation: Ans. B) USG abdomen is the investigation of choice in adults

questions.text: What is the management for a patient with a road traffic accident who presents with hemothorax, evidenced by 900 ml of blood loss via a chest tube in 1 hour?

options.label: C
options.text: Drain for next 3 hours and assess

questions.correct_answer: C. Drain for next 3 hours and assess
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Drain for next 3 hours and assess

questions.text: A preterm neonate shows respiratory distress. On examination, the neonate appears cyanotic with increased work of breathing. Auscultation reveals bowel sounds in the left hemithorax. Chest x-ray showed multiple air-fluid levels in the left thorax. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely responsible for these findings?
Which of the following is considered a “sure sign” of wound dehiscence in a post-operative patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Widening of the abdominal scar with palpable edges

questions.correct_answer: C. Serosanguinous drainage from the wound
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Serosanguinous drainage from the wound

questions.text: A patient presents in the emergency department with sudden hematemesis. He has been taking aspirin for his arthritis and drinks alcohol occasionally. He gives a history of occasional abdominal pain. On examination, there is no abdominal mass or tenderness. Which of these is a part of the management of the given condition in an emergency?
Identify the risk factor for the condition according to given image.

A 34-year-old female patient presents with lower abdominal pain, frequent urination, and signs of dehydration. Physical examination reveals abdominal tenderness and urine analysis indicates sterile pyuria. An image is provided. What is unlikely about the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It occurs due to Proteus infection in alkaline urine

options.label: B
options.text: It is seen in patients with poor immunity

options.label: C
options.text: Disease can spread to the bladder

questions.correct_answer: A. It occurs due to Proteus infection in alkaline urine
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It occurs due to Proteus infection in alkaline urine

questions.text: What is the defect seen below?

A female presented with pain and redness of the left breast. She is lactating for the last 3 months. On examination, local temperature is raised and cracked nipple is noted. Ultrasound of breast was suggestive of significant liquid collection of about 100 cc. What should be the next line of management?
Which of the following is not true about nephroblastoma?

options.label: C
options.text: Treatment is by chemotherapy and surgery

options.label: D
options.text: Presents with a huge intra-abdominal lump which doesn’t cross midline

questions.text: A young male presented with a significant dragging sensation in the scrotum. On examination, a bag of worm feel was noted in the left side of the scrotum. However, the testis were normal. What is the next step?
Identify the procedure leading to the complication shown in image:
Most common ectopic tissue found in Meckel’s diverticulum is/are? Gastric Colonic Pancreatic Thyroid
The procedure shown in the image is used in the treatment of lower limb varicose veins. What is the procedure and what type of anesthesia is commonly used for this procedure?
Identify the likely pathology on endoscopy in the image shown.
Which of these is an unlikely complication of benign enlargement of prostate?
Which of these is incorrect about dumping syndrome?
questions.correct_answer: B. Late dumping occurs after 1-3 days
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Late dumping occurs after 1-3 days

questions.text: Most accurate investigation for local staging of CA Prostate is:

A 56-year-old male presents to the emergency with abdominal pain and an episode of binge drinking in shock with a BP of 70/50 mm Hg and HR of 115/min. The oxygen saturation of the patient is 89%. Serum creatinine level was 2.4 mg/dL. What is the likely diagnosis based on the CT image shown below?
Which of the following is the suture material is used for vascular repair?

A 45-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of severe headaches, palpitations, and profuse sweating. Her blood pressure is persistently elevated at 180/100 mmHg. On further workup, elevated plasma metanephrines are found. What is the most likely diagnosis?
In the ATLS Primary Survey, what does the letter "D" stand for?

A 35-year-old man came with complaints of dark-colored stools to the OPD. After undergoing endoscopy, the patient was diagnosed with an upper GI bleed. Which of the following structures is used as a demarcation point to differentiate it from a lower GI bleed?
Identify the true statement about the instrument used in surgery.

options.label: A
options.text: It can be used for cutting as well as coagulation of tissue

options.label: B
options.text: It is safe in patients with pacemakers

options.label: C
options.text: It can coagulate vessels up to 7 mm

options.label: D
options.text: Patient return cautery pad is not a must while in use

questions.correct_answer: A. It can be used for cutting as well as coagulation of tissue
questions.explanation: Ans. A) It can be used for cutting as well as coagulation of tissue

questions.text: Four days after undergoing laparotomy for duodenal ulcer perforation, patient is started on clear liquids. He complains of epigastric discomfort and bilious vomiting. Abdominal examination reveals generalized distension without tenderness. All of these will be done next in management except:

options.label: A
options.text: Stop orals and insert NG tube

options.label: B
options.text: Stop orals and feed via NJ tube

questions.correct_answer: B. Stop orals and feed via NJ tube
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Stop orals and feed via NJ tube

questions.text: In which of the given cases is this procedure usually performed?
questions.correct_answer: C. BCT in node negative patients
questions.explanation: Ans. C) BCT in node negative patients

questions.text: A 40-year-old male patient presented in OPD with a swelling that has been slowly growing in the past 2 years. On examination, it was variable in consistency and mobile. What is the next step?
All of these are true regarding decubitus ulcer except?

options.label: A
options.text: Anemia and malnutrition contribute to its development

options.label: B
options.text: Most common site is the heel

options.label: C
options.text: A bedsore can be expected if erythema appears that does not change colour on pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. Most common site is the heel
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Most common site is the heel
